page.title: International reactions to the 2011 Egyptian revolution

rev.diff:
Line 16: Line 16:
:[[Foreign Affairs Minister of Iran|Iranian Foreign Minister]] [[Ali Akbar Salehi]] also hoped that the Egyptians' "high aims, national demands and resurrection of their glory could be achieved in the very near future." [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)|Iranian Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] spokesman [[Ramin Mehmanparast]] called on Egypt to "abide by the rightful demands of the nation."<ref>{{cite news |author=[[Staff writer]]|title=Egypt Protests Draw Mixed Reaction in Region|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/01/29/egypt.middle.east.reaction/|work=[[CNN]]|date=29 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> There were also "solidarity" protests outside the Egyptian interests section.{{clarify|date=January 2011}}<!--which embassy?-->
:[[Foreign Affairs Minister of Iran|Iranian Foreign Minister]] [[Ali Akbar Salehi]] also hoped that the Egyptians' "high aims, national demands and resurrection of their glory could be achieved in the very near future." [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)|Iranian Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] spokesman [[Ramin Mehmanparast]] called on Egypt to "abide by the rightful demands of the nation."<ref>{{cite news |author=[[Staff writer]]|title=Egypt Protests Draw Mixed Reaction in Region|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/01/29/egypt.middle.east.reaction/|work=[[CNN]]|date=29 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> There were also "solidarity" protests outside the Egyptian interests section.{{clarify|date=January 2011}}<!--which embassy?-->
:[[Islamic Consultative Assembly (Iran)|Iranian parliament speaker]] [[Ali Larijani]] said: "The voice of the brave people of Egypt is the voice of revolution. The start of this revolution has astonished the despotic regimes of the region. The parliament supports the uprising of the Tunisian and Egyptian people." He described the protests as "the revolution of the noble."<ref>{{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/Iran-backs-Egypts-revolution-of-the-noble/articleshow/7392036.cms|title=Iran Backs Egypt's 'Revolution of the Noble'|publisher=''[[Agence France-Presse]]'' (via ''[[The Times of India]]'')|date=30 January 2011|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Iran backed the protests, calling{{Who|date=February 2011}} them "revolution of the noble". It compared Western reaction to the protests with the Western reaction to the 1979 [[Iranian Revolution]].<ref>{{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|title=Iran Backs Egypt's 'Revolution of the Noble'|publisher=''[[Agence France-Presse]]'' (via ''[[The Times of India]]'')|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/Iran-backs-Egypts-revolution-of-the-noble/articleshow/7392036.cms|date=30 January 2011|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref>
:[[Islamic Consultative Assembly (Iran)|Iranian parliament speaker]] [[Ali Larijani]] said: "The voice of the brave people of Egypt is the voice of revolution. The start of this revolution has astonished the despotic regimes of the region. The parliament supports the uprising of the Tunisian and Egyptian people." He described the protests as "the revolution of the noble."<ref>{{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/Iran-backs-Egypts-revolution-of-the-noble/articleshow/7392036.cms|title=Iran Backs Egypt's 'Revolution of the Noble'|publisher=''[[Agence France-Presse]]'' (via ''[[The Times of India]]'')|date=30 January 2011|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Iran backed the protests, calling{{Who|date=February 2011}} them "revolution of the noble". It compared Western reaction to the protests with the Western reaction to the 1979 [[Iranian Revolution]].<ref>{{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|title=Iran Backs Egypt's 'Revolution of the Noble'|publisher=''[[Agence France-Presse]]'' (via ''[[The Times of India]]'')|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/Iran-backs-Egypts-revolution-of-the-noble/articleshow/7392036.cms|date=30 January 2011|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref>
â
*[[Mir Hossein Mousavi]] and [[Mehdi Karroubi]], former presidential candidates and the leaders of the [[Iranian Green Movement|Green Movement]], released a statement from their virtual [[house arrest]] in Tehran, assuring the Egyptians: "No power can suppress the people's will and demand. Sooner or later, autocratic and tyrant power[s] are sentenced to vanish."<ref name="Khamenei"/>
+
:[[Mir Hossein Mousavi]] and [[Mehdi Karroubi]], former presidential candidates and the leaders of the [[Iranian Green Movement|Green Movement]], released a statement from their virtual [[house arrest]] in Tehran, assuring the Egyptians: "No power can suppress the people's will and demand. Sooner or later, autocratic and tyrant power[s] are sentenced to vanish."<ref name="Khamenei"/>
*{{flag|Iraq}} — Prime Minister [[Nouri al-Maliki]] stated "The people have the right to express what they want without being persecuted... One of the characteristics of a lack of democracy is when a leader rules for 30 or 40 years. It is a difficult issue for people, it is intolerable and change is necessary."<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12373767 Iraq PM Nouri Maliki 'will not seek third term'] ''[[BBC News]]''. 2011-02-05.</ref>
*{{flag|Iraq}} — Prime Minister [[Nouri al-Maliki]] stated "The people have the right to express what they want without being persecuted... One of the characteristics of a lack of democracy is when a leader rules for 30 or 40 years. It is a difficult issue for people, it is intolerable and change is necessary."<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12373767 Iraq PM Nouri Maliki 'will not seek third term'] ''[[BBC News]]''. 2011-02-05.</ref>
:The Foreign Ministry wished Egypt and its citizens "progress and prosperity."<ref name="mofairaq"/>
:The Foreign Ministry wished Egypt and its citizens "progress and prosperity."<ref name="mofairaq"/>
